title: Workshop on Science Education Innovation and Classroom Culture Transformation Through Inquiry-Based Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic mathematics instruction, understanding of secondary education curriculum, proficiency in digital tool utilization
context.additional_context: An in-service math teacher serving as a corporate educator, interested in developing creative pedagogical methods for real-life problem-solving, with the ability to use digital collaboration tools in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners propose at least three integrated science-math lesson designs using inquiry-based collaborative learning models.
Learners develop two+ strategies to foster learner-driven inquiry cultures using classroom blogs and digital collaboration tools.
Learners can diagnose their conceptual understanding level during the inquiry process with 80% accuracy using formative assessment tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
